DataElement.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic Regional Lymph Node N Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for melanoma of the skin based on evidence obtained from pathologic examination through completion of definitive surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin. Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi. Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.

Concepts.definition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin.  Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi.  Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/9/18 tt moved to NCI Standards Context. Created for CRF standard harmonization. Released per final community approval. mc 5/7/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic N Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous melanoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.  The TNM clinical and pathologic regional lymph nodes tumor classifications of cutaneous melanoma are not the same. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2b TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2b TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with macrometastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes.  Macrometastases are defined as clinically detectable nodal metastases confirmed by therapeutic lymphadenectomy or when nodal metastasis exhibits gross extracapsular extension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2b TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with macrometastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes.  Macrometastases are defined as clinically detectable nodal metastases confirmed by therapeutic lymphadenectomy or when nodal metastasis exhibits gross extracapsular extension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with micrometastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes.  Micrometastases are diagnosed after sentinel lymph node biopsy and completion of lymphadenectomy (if performed). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with micrometastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes.  Micrometastases are diagnosed after sentinel lymph node biopsy and completion of lymphadenectomy (if performed). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with metastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes or in transit met(s)/satellite(s) without metastatic nodes. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with metastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes or in transit met(s)/satellite(s) without metastatic nodes. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pN1b TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN1b TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with macrometastasis in one regional lymph node.  Macrometastases are defined as clinically detectable nodal metastases confirmed by therapeutic lymphadenectomy or when nodal metastasis exhibits gross extracapsular extension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN1b TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with macrometastasis in one regional lymph node.  Macrometastases are defined as clinically detectable nodal metastases confirmed by therapeutic lymphadenectomy or when nodal metastasis exhibits gross extracapsular extension. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pN1a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN1a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with micrometastasis in one regional lymph node.  Micrometastases are diagnosed after sentinel lymph node biopsy and completion of lymphadenectomy (if performed). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN1a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with micrometastasis in one regional lymph node.  Micrometastases are diagnosed after sentinel lymph node biopsy and completion of lymphadenectomy (if performed). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma without involvement of regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN0 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma without involvement of regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pN1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with metastasis in one regional lymph node. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with metastasis in one regional lymph node. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2c TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2c TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma with intralymphatic metastases (in transit or satellite metastases) without metastatic nodes. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN2c TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma with intralymphatic metastases (in transit or satellite metastases) without metastatic nodes. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Melanoma pNX TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma pNX TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed (e.g., previously removed for another reason).  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pNX TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed (e.g., previously removed for another reason).  (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous melanoma involving four or more regional lymph nodes, or with a finding of matted metastatic nodes, or with in-transit metastasis or satellite(s) with metastasis in regional lymph node(s). (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Melanoma pN3 TNM Finding v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous melanoma involving four or more regional lymph nodes, or with a finding of matted metastatic nodes, or with in-transit metastasis or satellite(s) with metastasis in regional lymph node(s). (from AJCC 6th and 7th Eds.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

The TNM clinical and pathologic regional lymph nodes tumor classifications of cutaneous melanoma are not the same. Concepts.definition: A finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous melanoma, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system.  The TNM clinical and pathologic regional lymph nodes tumor classifications of cutaneous melanoma are not the same. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
